intro: Paepalanthus albescens, commonly known as the white-flowered grass of the Andes, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
